intro: Viola teshioensis, commonly known as the Teshio violet, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped leaves and violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and mountainous regions. It is noted for its small stature and is often found in the Teshio area of Hokkaido. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
